Bloak.comment: The site owner. I started making arrangements just after knowing Touhou, and without any musical knowledge, so don't take them seriously (lol). The works displayed here are my own favorites, but still not comparable to those from other great artists. To view my other works (as well as piano performances), visit my bilibili channel and check the video lists.

朋夜.comment: The website 【光と闇の協奏曲】 contains all the audio files. However, there is no direct url to individual files, so I won't link them in the performance section.

website.title: 海老福落雷電解研究所

海老福.comment:
The artist stated that he recorded his performances as MIDI and did some manipulation on it, and the sheet music were made afterwards (see http://abfuku.asuscomm.com/pic/abmemo.txt). I have to say his sheets are quite messy... 
Some notes on practice/performance: 
1. Notice the two-part right hand texture. Be sure to distinguish the melody from the accompaniment by playing it louder. The audios didn't demonstrate this enough. 
2. All arrangements are loops, just like the original game music, so you will need to add a proper ending yourself.

chiquchoo.comment: The old site contains analysis and performance guide for each piece.

Denko.comment: The old site contains analysis and performance guide for each piece.

kituneyuu.comment: The artist's niconico account was deleted. Still, you can go to one of their videos and click 'next' or 'previous,' which will take you through the entire list.

akikiki.comment: The artist's works were later played by Alioth and included in Assaultdoor's albums. However, I couldn't find any audio from the CDs, so I'll just provide the links to the original score-videos from niconico and omit the "circle" and "album" entries.

Mitty.comment:
The artist has been inactive on twitter since 2020. A youtube comment in 2021 said he has already died (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qIz1PgpDKnw). 
The website,  http://mystic9th.com/ , has expired, and no sheet music was retrieved. The web archive saved his homepage (with little information) and two other sub-pages, one for his arrangements and another for his analysis of touhou OST and CDs. Check out https://web.archive.org/web/20170711192609/http://mystic9th.com:80/touhou.htm and https://web.archive.org/web/20170331204818/http://mystic9th.com:80/touhou_analyses.htm

ありおと.comment: The artist's performance is usually different from the score (if arranged by other artists).

SHI.comment: The artist's youtube channel still exists but all touhou related contents were deleted or hidden. Seaside (SHI's circle) website http://www.seaside-musix.net/ is also down (you can visit its webarchive page but there's no mp3). The only source I have is kkcwkoh's videos and Quellatalo's transcriptions.

柊秀雪.comment: It seems that As/Hi Soundworks had an old site which displayed sheet music but it was taken down for unknown reasons. He has been publishing performance videos on youtube recently, sometimes with score snippets. You could ask for sheet music in the video comments and he might share it.

Midori Yakumo.comment: A mysterious transcriber who appears in the comment section of touhou music videos and casually drops a transcription.

ポンジョウ.comment: The artist stated on the website "一応人間が物理的には弾けそうな感じに作っていますが、どちらかと言えば観賞用です。実際に弾く場合は適当に音を間引かないと難しいかもしれません。" (Although it is made to look like it can be physically popped by humans, it is rather ornamental. When actually playing, it may be difficult if you do not thin out the sound properly.) I'd suggest you be careful with all kind of midi arrangements for the same reason. It's easy for a program to tweek the volume of each voice but hard for a human to do it.

website.title: 社会人でもゆっくりしたい

アマツミカボシ.comment: Artificial Reverie homepage (http://artificialreverie.web.fc2.com) and blog (http://artificialreverie.blog110.fc2.com/) have both been shut down. It seems like the artist changed their name to 串田葉 and started a new circle called Cincleaf. However, its homepage (http://cincleaf.com) was also shut down.

清水 嶺.comment: Unknown Dimension only published one Touhou doujin CD – 紅魔館にピアノなんかあったっけ？ (There Was a Piano in the Scarlet Devil Mansion?), which contains 6 piano arrangements in jazz style. Quellatalo has transcribed all of them. Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL5TBIb3nL2DRuol3Zz-Z-FNZOumyCTr_e
